alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Estill; Lee; Powell; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Powell, east central Estill, northwestern Breathitt, northeastern Lee and Wolfe Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Leeco, or 8 miles west of Campton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Booth, Rogers and Pine Ridge around 1235 PM EDT. High Falls and Grannie around 1240 PM EDT. Campton, Vortex, Mary, Calaboose and Flat around 1245 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Baptist, Landsaw, Stillwater, Trent, Hollonville, Lane, Bethany, Pence, Lexie, Malaga, Paxton, Hazel Green, Wilhurst, Vancleve and Sewell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern and east central Kentucky.
